conclusion: Need to find particle's position on x-axis after 8 seconds using v-t graph.
Particle starts at x = 5 m at t = 0 and moves along x-axis.
Graph shows velocity in m/s against time in seconds.
Vertical red lines in the image may help calculate area under the curve.
Area under velocity-time graph represents displacement.
Find displacement from t = 0 to t = 8 s and add to initial position for final position.
From t = 0 to t = 1 s, velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s.
From t = 1 to t = 3 s, velocity stays constant at 2 m/s.
From t = 3 to t = 4 s, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
From t = 4 to t = 5 s, velocity becomes negative, decreasing linearly from 0 to -1 m/s.
From t = 5 to t = 7 s, velocity remains constant at -1 m/s.
From t = 7 to t = 8 s, velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 m/s.
Calculate area under graph for each interval and sum for total displacement.
t = 0 to t = 1 s: Area = 1 m (triangle), displacement positive.
t = 1 to t = 3 s: Displacement = 4 m (constant velocity).
t = 3 to t = 4 s: Area = 1 m (triangle).
Total displacement t = 0 to t = 4 s: 6 m, position = 11 m.
t = 4 to t = 5 s: Area = 0.5 m (negative triangle), displacement negative.
Subtract 0.5 m: Total displacement = 5.5 m, position = 10.5 m.
t = 5 to t = 7 s: Displacement = -2 m (constant negative velocity).
Subtract 2 m: Total displacement = 3.5 m, position = 8.5 m.
